pronunciation: POMEGRAN'ATE, [Latin pomum, an apple, and granatum, grained. See Grain and Granate.]

definitions.text:
1. The fruit of tree belonging to the genus Punica. This fruit is as large as orange, having hard rind filled with soft pulp and numerous seeds. It is of reddish color.
2. The tree that produces pomegranates.
3. An ornament resembling pomegranate on the robe and ephod of the Jewish high priest.
